wikipedia_page.main: Hugo Arthur Rundell Guinness (born 12 September 1959) is a British artist, illustrator and writer. He is known for his illustrations in The New York Times and his bold, graphic black-and-white block prints, many of which have appeared in films and publications. He is perhaps best known for his collaborations with film director Wes Anderson.

response: | Also co-writer (story only, with Wes Anderson, Roman Coppola and Hugo Guinness)
